greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest m such that A343156(m) = n, or -1 if no such m exists.
reference: Eric Angelini, W. Edwin Clark, Hans Havermann, Frank Stevenson, Allan C. Wechsler, and others, Postings to Math Fun mailing list, April 2021.
example: 2 takes 0 steps to reach a prime, so a(0) = 2.
10 -> 25 -> 5 takes 2 steps to reach a prime (and no smaller number takes that many steps), so a(2) = 10.
35 -> 57 -> 319 -> 1129 takes 3 steps to reach a prime (and no smaller number takes that many steps), so a(3) = 35.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2021
